abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Coral Reef
            Rehabilitation and Management Project for Indonesia were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that projects
            should adopt a broad ecosystem-based approach in addressing
            coral reef conservation, focusing on fisheries. Communities
            should be the focus of coral reef ecosystem and fisheries
            management activities. Coral reef ecosystem and fisheries
            management is a time-consuming process of consensus-building
            among resource users and stakeholders. Coral reef ecosystem
            and fisheries management will benefit from decentralization.
            Communities and local government need central government or
            other external partners to manage coral reef ecosystems and
            fisheries. Coral reef MCS and enforcement measures must be
            cost-effective and sustainable. In dealing with diverse and
            dynamic communities, flexibility must be incorporated into
            the design of all coral reef ecosystem and fisheries
            management activities. Fully-protected marine reserves
            should be selected based on some fisheries criteria. Marine
            protected areas require long-term funding and institutional
            commitments from both donors and governments. It is vital to
            incorporate specific provisions for coordination among
            components. It is important to begin working early with a
            borrower on the preparation for the next Adaptable Program
            Loan (APL) phase, most likely from the time of the mid-term
            review, in order to avoid financing gaps and ensure
            continuity between phases. Project designs should provide
            for information exchange within the relevant scientific and
            development agency communities.
